VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Allow a B2B Commerce for Visualforce Guest Buyer to Check Out

By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce requires a guest buyer to register for a storefront account before they can check out. To allow a guest buyer to check out without registering for a storefront account, set up the appropriate Visualforce page, custom object, and Apex class permissions.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To set Visualforce page security:	Manage Profiles and Permission Sets
To create, customize, or publish an Experience Cloud site:	

Create and Set Up Experiences

AND

View Setup and Configuration

NOTE In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), asynchronous processing for order placement isn't compatible with guest checkout. All orders are processed synchronously for a guest buyer.

To allow a guest buyer to check out:

Verify that you've set up the required sharing rules for guest user access to the checkout-related B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects. Review the steps in Create Sharing Rules for Guest User Access to Storefront Objects.
NOTE These sharing rules allow guest user access even when you complete the security alerts for preventing unauthorized guest user access.
Update your storefront settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select General (2).
Scroll to the Storefront Flags section, and enable Allow Anonymous Checkout (3).
Scroll back to the top and click Save (4).
Update your Experience Cloud site's guest user profile with access to the required Visualforce pages.
From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Click Workspaces next to your site, and then click the Administration workspace tile.
From the Administration menu, select Pages, and then click Go to Force.com.
On the Site Detail page, click Public Access Settings.

The profile that the site automatically created for your guest users displays. By default, the guest user profile is named Site Name Profile, such as DefaultStore Profile.

On the profile detail page, select Enabled Visualforce Page Access, and click Edit.
Add the following Visualforce pages to the Enabled Visualforce Pages list, and click Save.
ccrz.CheckOutNew for standard checkout flow
ccrz.CCPaymentInfo
ccrz.OrderConfirmation
IMPORTANT The ccrz.CheckOut Visualforce page is used with line-level independence (LLI) checkout flow. However, a guest buyer can use LLI only when the following conditions are satisfied:
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or earlier, a guest buyer can use LLI only when you haven't completed the guest user access security alerts. Because these security alerts are mandatory, guest checkout effectively isn't supported with LLI for these versions.
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later removes this limitation. Guest checkout is compatible with LLI in this version. However, guest checkout always uses synchronous processing for placing an order, even when your storefront has enabled the Process Orders Asynchronously configuration of the Checkout module.
Update your site's guest user profile with access to the CC Order custom object.
On the profile detail page, click Edit.
Scroll to the Custom Object Permissions section. Find the CC Orders custom object, select Read.
Click Save.
IMPORTANT Have you upgraded from a version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce earlier than Spring ’19 (version 4.10)? Verify that you've enabled access to the ccrz.cc_ctrl_Formatter and ccrz.cc_util_Order Apex classes on the site's guest user profile. These Apex classes help support the order confirmation email functionality. For more information, see:
Send Order Confirmation Emails Asynchronously
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ‘19 (Version 4.10)
